docs.text: bats is this year's camp flick .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with the world's worst dialogue , cheesiest premise and stupidest editor , this one should be heaven for those who enjoy films humorous in their inanity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as for the rest of us , well . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'd say skip it , but looking at the box office figures for this one , it seems as though most of america is following that advice anyway .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: follow their lead and you'll spare yourself 90 minutes of your life and 8 bucks to boot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i love alfred hitchcock's the birds , almost as much as i love the short story on which it is based .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it saddens me even more , then , to see that american treasure ripped off so blatantly by wannabe horror/schlock such as bats .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when mysterious bat attacks occur in a small texas town , the authorities call in a batologist ( dina meyer ) to investigate .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it turns out that a creepy scientist ( bob gunton ) has genetically enhanced a couple bats that escaped from his lab , making them smarter and more vicious .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: why has he done this , you ask ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: because , you see , it is apparently a scientist's job to make things " a little better , " even if that means the death of all mankind .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so the batologist , her wisecracking sidekick and the town sheriff ( lou diamond phillips ) have to kill all the bats and save the world .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course , that can't happen before they wallow in some guamo ( bat shit , for the uninitiated ) , get up close and personal with some truly repulsive flying mammals and survive some of the dumbest situations ever seen in a professionally produced motion picture .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: consider , for example , a scene where two people are in a bat cave .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the bats are all sleeping , but the humans are afraid they might wake up before they can get out .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what do they do ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: do they get the hell out of there as fast as they can ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: nope .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they stand there for a while , transfixed by the thousands of bats opening their eyes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what keeps bats from being scary or creepy is the hyperactive editing in most of the attack scenes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we don't even get to see what's going on ; the screen becomes a mush because the cuts are so quick .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all we know is that bats are attacking .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: how they are attacking and what exactly is happening remains a mystery .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a little technical proficiency does wonders for horror movies , and bats sure could use some .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course , director louis morneau tries to liven things up with some intentional humor , but it is so conventional it doesn't really go anywhere .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of the ocmic relief comes courtesy of the batologist's wisecracking sidekick ( leon ) , who takes every opportunity to sputter ingenious lines like " i hate bats ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some of these are so bad that they take on a double quality : they may inspire a smirk by their very nature and a roaring laugh because they are so inept .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i hate characters who exist for the sole purpose of spouting lame one-liners .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: playing such characters does not help actors' careers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: still , i suppose that if you're looking for a movie that is " so bad it's good , " you could do worse than bats .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it does have a tremendous amount of camp value .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'm not " recommending " the movie because , quite frankly , it sucks , and i know that this might convince some people to go out and see it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: more power to them .
docs.label: negative
